intro: Cleistes bifaria, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Americas, is a rare and delicate herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Oenotheraceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant, white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces a unique, urn-shaped bloom with a distinctive, sweet scent. Cleistes bifaria is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swampy areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species in many regions.
